Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; alternating red and black tongues with added white outline between red and white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of parts of two male figures with light brown coloured flesh striding to right (of first figure, leg and part of short red and black dotted chiton remains, of second only one leg).
Curator's comments: Lemos describes a hairy figure behind the male figures. There is no evidence of such a figure. Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the Naukratis Painter. The painter and the group are named after a chalice found at Naukratis and the slip on all vessels from this group is a light beige to almost creamy white. Rim patterns are very simple and there is no filling ornament. The depiction of figures, however, is very elaborate. Clothing is rendered highly decorated and naked skin is expertly portrayed.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 111, p. 278, no. 760, pl. IV, pl. 99)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (pl. VI, no. 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0776) (phase 2)
Williams 1983 / Sophilos in the British Museum (p. 160 note 4)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens
Acquisition notes: Presented by the Committee of the British School at Athens.
